intro: Tinospora merrilliana, commonly known as the Indian moonseed, is a woody climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by berries that turn red when mature. It is often found in tropical forests and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological contexts.
